result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Abdullah Almakrami

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Passport Reinventoried to Room 419 of the Safety Bldg.
No reply from surety or defendant.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  Defendant has been DISCHARGED from Pretrial Supervision.
Notice of bail/bond forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($10,000.00) ad
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 10000.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Eric M Hailstock in court.  Christopher Liegel for Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Court orders bail forfeited.  Surrender of passport will be maintained.  
A call was made to Attorney Steinle's office, he has NOT been retained.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Abdullah Almakrami in court with attorney Eric M Hailstock.  Paul Tiffin for Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense Counsel informs the Court that the Defendant is in the process of obtaining private counsel, Attorney Steinle.  State has no objection to an adjournment at this time.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 4/11/14.

14RM019271  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff: 04-09-2014
Defendants PASSPORT SURRENDERED to the Clerk's Office this date. jew

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING BREATHALYZER TESTS AND ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO SURRENDER PASSPORT TO CLERK OF COURT.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with EJ, HER RESIDENCE,  EMPLOYMENT OR SCHOOL.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Abdullah Almakrami in court with attorney Mary P. Polenz.  Defendant Abdullah Almakrami in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WAGNER, Branch 38.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
